citations.narrative:
The hamsters are housed in shoe-box style caging with Tek-Fresh paper bedding material. It was noted during the
inspection that the bedding material located under the water bottles in 2 enclosures was saturated with fluid. The
hamsters had to stand on the wet bedding material in order to access their source of drinking water.
Per this Section, in the event a primary enclosure becomes soiled or wet to a degree that might be uncomfortable for the
hamsters, the hamsters should be transferred to clean primary enclosures. Wet bedding material cannot effectively
absorb fluids and standing on wet bedding can result in uncomfortable foot issues in the hamsters. The facility needs to
change enclosures when the bedding material becomes wet for the health and comfort of the animals. Correct by 8/30/24.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representative.
*END OF REPORT*
